column4: how do I check whcih windows manager I;m using? I get a kubuntu flashscreen, kubuntu cursor, but everything else looks like gdm.
ugh, typos.
ps -e will list every process on the system :)
If metacity is the gnome window manager.
Do you have a gnome-panel or kde panel?
I see things like gdm-session-worker and gnome-session. but I also see things like kdeinit4 and klauncher, and mutter.
no metacity
You have both running together some how for some reason.
how do I switch to gdm yet still be able to open kde apps?
Well.  when you log in choose "gnome" in the sessions menu.  The KDE apps will still show up in your menu and they'll work.  You don't have to log into kde (or gnome) to use apps from kde (or gnome).
the wm just logs in - no pulldown for sessions. How do I get it back?
Do not have to put in your password / username at all?
correct.
Are you in KDE now or gnome?
like I said, kde cursor, kde loadscreen, yet gnome-like look. UNR with Unity.
gnome
try this: "gksu gdmsetup"
I get the pane, I click unlock, and nothing happens. All options are inactive.
What?  Did you run "gksudo gdmsetup"
except close
exactly.
